location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter No 150 A.P. from Charles Umpherston Aitchison, Secretary to the Government of India, Fort William [Calcutta] to Lewis Pelly, The Agent to the Governor General and Special Commissioner Baroda

physicalDescription.extent: The statement of offences, itemised as folio 8, is an enclosure to this letter.

mods.abstract: Letter forwarding a copy of the statement of offences against His Highness Mulhar Rao [Malharrao] Guikwar [Gaekwad] which will be investigated by a special commission and requesting that Pelly send a copy of the depositions and charges to His Highness along with a copy of the statement made by the Government of India.The letter goes on to state that the Bombay Government and Advocate General at Bombay [Andrew Richard Scoble] will be arranging the prosecution of the case and requests that Pelly write directly to the Advocate General to inform him of the notices given to His Highness thus far. The letter also notes that as these are political and not legal proceedings the use of legal terms is to be avoided and popular expressions should be used instead.
